intro: Aetanthus validus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in early summer. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Aetanthus validus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
